recipe.ingredients: Spices have always been valued for their ability to add flavour, colour and aroma to dishes, but before the advent of refrigeration they were also an important means of food preservation, and in some cultures their medicinal and antiseptic characteristics are revered. The regional cuisines of India, Thailand, Indonesia and Malaysia rely a great deal on spices. Spice mixes are important in these countries, but will often be in fresh paste form rather than the dried spice mixes found in the UK.
